page.title: 08WARRINGTON R.L.F.C.
page.content: {Warrington Rugby League Football Club} The present club was founded in 1879 but, originally, played Rugby Union. Thirteen-a-side rugby began in 1895. The "Wires" nickname of the team came from the wire-drawing industry which was once prominent in the town. The present ground-capacity is 13,500 but it once held 30,000 people. A fire in 1983 destroyed the main stand, but the new South Stand holds 2,000 spectators. The club is at present in debt, owing to the rebuilding, but the weekly 'gate' money is insufficient to cover normal running costs. Consequently sponsorship plays an important part in the club's finances. Television coverage of the game is paid for into a "pool" which is fairly distributed amongst the league clubs.
